pr_title: Update triplea-maps YAML and intellij setup

timeline.message: Making the documentation a little easier to understand, and learning how to do everything myself.

Merge pull request #1 from triplea-game/master

testing my fork

Merge pull request #2 from triplea-game/master

Option to load any save (#7894)

timeline.bodyText: nit, avoiding dependencies in documentation makes it easier to maintain. Specifically the "4 plugins", if we add a plugin to the list either that will be out of date or we'll need to update it. One could say instead "There are a few plugins to install..." which would make it more generic and less likely to become out of date.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,27 @@
 ## *IntelliJ* Setup
 
-### Plugins:
-  - *Google Java Format*
-    - *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
-    - Check 'enable'
+Setting up *IntelliJ* is pretty simple.  There are 4 plugins to install with the associated settings, and some settings to download and import.

replies.bodyText: Will keep that in mind.  Thanks
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: Giving a link to the checkstyle file might make this easier?
timeline.author: DanVanAtta
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,27 @@
 ## *IntelliJ* Setup
 
-### Plugins:
-  - *Google Java Format*
-    - *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
-    - Check 'enable'
+Setting up *IntelliJ* is pretty simple.  There are 4 plugins to install with the associated settings, and some settings to download and import.  
+
+### Plugins: 
+  1. *Google Java Format*
+        1. *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
+        2.  Check 'enable'
       ![Screenshot from 2019-08-08 17-35-52
       ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12397753/62746114-07cc2b80-ba03-11e9-9ac0-0b1e6e1e8788.png)
-  - *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
-    - after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
-    - select checkstyle file:
-  - *Save Actions*
-    - configure in settings to add 'final' to local variables and class variables.
-  - *Lombok*
+  2. *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
+        1. after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
+        2. select checkstyle file:

replies.bodyText: The 'select checkstyle file' was there before i changed anything.  I don't know what it is, so i figured i shouldn't delete it either.
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

replies.bodyText: Ah, indeed it is an important step. There are two built-in checkstyle settings, you do need to explicitly select and import and the tripleA checkstyle. It's probably worth mentioning that the setting to 'scan test sources' should be selected as well so IDEA will run checkstyle on test files.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
Okay, then if I am going to do that part correctly, i will need a link to the checkstyle settings to link.  And frankly, i probably don't have them set correctly myself right now because they weren't in the document before.
Also, is this the setting you are referring to when you say 'scan test sources'?
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

replies.bodyText:
@CharlieAtlas I updated this documentation with that screenshot:
#7932
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: so apparently my checkstyle isn't up to date?  or is yours an older one?  Where do i get checkstyle.xml?  i see one called checkstyle-IDEA.xml in the zip file, is that it?
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

replies.bodyText:
8.8 is slightly older, I think the latest is 8.30 something. Our conflict XML is a bit dated so only the older version works.
The checkstyle.xml file is checked in, you should be able to find it in the cloned code:
https://github.com/triplea-game/triplea/blob/master/config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
8.36.2 is the current version.  So i need to regress to/select 8.8 then?
I can't seem to import the settings.
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

timeline.bodyText: 👍  Cool, I'm glad to see the plugin configurations well documented now.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,27 @@
 ## *IntelliJ* Setup
 
-### Plugins:
-  - *Google Java Format*
-    - *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
-    - Check 'enable'
+Setting up *IntelliJ* is pretty simple.  There are 4 plugins to install with the associated settings, and some settings to download and import.  
+
+### Plugins: 
+  1. *Google Java Format*
+        1. *settings > Other settings > google-java-format*
+        2.  Check 'enable'
       ![Screenshot from 2019-08-08 17-35-52
       ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12397753/62746114-07cc2b80-ba03-11e9-9ac0-0b1e6e1e8788.png)
-  - *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
-    - after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
-    - select checkstyle file:
-  - *Save Actions*
-    - configure in settings to add 'final' to local variables and class variables.
-  - *Lombok*
+  2. *checkstyle-IDEA* [plugin](https://github.com/jshiell/checkstyle-idea)
+        1. after install finish configuration in: **Other Settings > Checkstyle**
+        2. select checkstyle file:
+  3. *Save Actions*
+        1. **Settings > Other settings > Save Actions**
+        2. Select 'Activate save actions on save'
+        3. configure in settings to add 'final' to local variables and class variables. 
+  4. *Lombok*

timeline.bodyText: Nit, most markdown you can use 1 for each item in the numbered list and the numbering will be done automatically. This lets you insert items in the middle of the list without having to renumber the whole thing.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: I saw it here and one of your other comments, what is nit?
replies.author: CharlieAtlas

replies.bodyText:
"nit" is short for "nitpick". You will probably see that and 'side-comment' from reviewers. 'side-comment' means discussion about something that already existed and is not for the current PR.
Nits can be frustrating if a reivew is all nitpicks and is not looking at the larger picture. A comment prefaced as a nit is an acknowledgement that it's a pretty low-level type of thing being commented on. So while ideally we would not need to nitpick, it is code, and the details do add up and can be very important.
replies.author: DanVanAtta
